The training rule on shaking the head

original: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṁ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
analyzed: tena samayena buddhaḥ bhagavā sāvatthiyam viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme
translated: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,

original: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū sīsappacālakaṁ antaraghare gacchanti sīsaṁ olambentā …pe….
analyzed: tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyāḥ bhikkhū sīsappacālakam antara ghare gacchanti sīsam olambentā pe
translated: the monks from the group of six were shaking their heads while walking in inhabited areas.

analyzed: na sīsappacālakam antaraghare gamissāmi iti sikkhā karaṇīyā ati
translated: “‘I will not shake my head while walking in inhabited areas,’ this is how you should train.”
One should not shake one’s head while walking in an inhabited area.
One should walk with one’s head covered.

original: Yo anādariyaṁ paṭicca sīsappacālakaṁ antaraghare gacchati sīsaṁ olambento, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
analyzed: yaḥ anādariyam paṭicca sīsappacālakam antaraghare gacchati sīsam olambento āpatti dukkaṭassa
translated: If a monk, out of disrespect, shakes his head while walking in an inhabited area, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
if he is the first offender.🔽The ninth training rule is finished.
